gurmukhi: <> siqgur pRswid ]
transliteration: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?
translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

gurmukhi: 1 gurmuK l`Cx
transliteration: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?
translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

gurmukhi: pihlw gurmuiK jnmu lY BY ivic vrqY hoie ieAwxw
transliteration: Pahilaa Guramoukhi Janamu Lai Bhai Vichi Varatai Hoi Iaanaa.
translation: Having been born in this world, the gurmukh becoming innocent and ignorant ducts himself in the fear of the Lord.

gurmukhi: gur isK lY gurisKu hoie Bwie Bgiq ivic Krw isAwxw
transliteration: Gur Sikh Lai Gurasikhu Hoi Bhaai Bhagati Vichi Kharaa Siaanaa.
translation: Adopting the teaching of the Guru becomes the Sikh of the Guru and sustaining himself in the loving devotion, e leads a pure and intelligent life.

gurmukhi: gurisK suix mMnY smiJ mwx mhiq ivic rhY inmwxw
transliteration: Gur Sikh Souni Mannai Samajhi Maani Mahati Vichi Rahai Nimaanaa.
translation: After listening to and understanding it, e accepts the teachings of the Guru and even earning the glories continues be humble.

gurmukhi: gur isK gurisKu pUjdw pYrI pY rihrws luBwxw
transliteration: Gur Sikh Gurasikhu Poojadaa Pairee Pai Raharaasi Loubhaanaa.
translation: In accordance with the teachings of the Guru, he worships the e Sikhs and touching their feet and, following their virtus path, he becomes avourite of all.

gurmukhi: gur isK mnhu n ivsrY clxu jwix jugiq imhmwxw
transliteration: Gur Sikh Manahu N Visarai Chalanu Jaani Jougati Mihamaanaa.
translation: Guru's instruction is never forgotten by the Sikh and he having learnt the way of considering himself as a passing guest, spends his life (purposefully) here.

gurmukhi: gurisK imTw bolxw iniv clxw gurisKu prvwxw
transliteration: Gur Sikh Mitdaa Bolanaa Nivi Chalanaa Gurasikhu Paravaanaa.
translation: The Sikh of the Guru speaks sweetly and accept  humility as the proper way of life.

gurmukhi: Gwil Kwie gurisK imil Kwxw ]1]
transliteration: Ghaali Khaai Gurasikh Mili Khaanaa ?1?
translation: The Gurmukh, guru-oriented person earns is livelihood by hard labour and shares his victuals with other Sikhs of the um.

gurmukhi: 2 gurmuK-qwx inqwxw
translation: Gurmukh strong yet humble-

gurmukhi: idsit drs ilv swvDwnu sbd suriq cyqMnu isAwxw
transliteration: Disati Daras Liv Saavadhaanu Sabad Surati Chaytannu Siaanaa.
translation: The vision of a gurmukh remains seated in his desire for the glimpse of the Lord, and by virtue of his watchful realization of the sabad, he acquires wisdom.

gurmukhi: nwmu dwnu iesnwnu idVu mn bc krm krY mylwxw
transliteration: Naamu Daanu Isanaanu Dirhu Man Bach Karam Karai Maylaanaa.
translation: Being steadfast in meditation upon mint, charity, and ablution, he maintains co-ordination in his mind, speech and actions.

gurmukhi: gurisK QoVw bolxw QoVw sauxw QoVw Kwxw
transliteration: Gurasikh Dorhaa Bolanaa Dorhaa Saounaa Dorhaa Khaanaa.
translation: The Sikh of the Guru speaks less, sleeps less and eats little.

gurmukhi: pr qn pr Dn prhrY pr inMdw suix min srmwxw
transliteration: Par Tan Par Dhan Paraharai Par Nidaa Souni Mani Saramaanaa.
translation: Repudiating other's body (woman) and other's wealth he avoids listening to the slander of others.

gurmukhi: gur mUriq gur sbdu hY swDsMgiq smsir prvwxw
transliteration: Gur Moorati Satigur Sabadu Saadhasangati Samasari Paravaanaa.
translation: He accepts the presence of Guru equally in the sabad (Word) and the holy congregation.

gurmukhi: iek min ieku ArwDxw duqIAw nwsiq BwvY Bwxw
transliteration: Ik Mani Iku Araadhanaa Douteeaa Naasati Bhaavai Bhaanaa.
translation: With single-mindedness he adores the one Lord, and having no sense of duality, he rejoices in the will of the Lord.

gurmukhi: gurmuiK hodY qwx inqwxw ]2]
transliteration: Guramoukhi Hodai Taani Nitaanaa ?2?
translation: Despite his all powers the gurmukh considers himself meek and humble .

gurmukhi: 3 mnmuK, gurmuK qoN ivrvw, mnmuK mUrK hIxw qy iek`lw hY
translation: The self-willed one is a fool, deprived and alone,   ,

gurmukhi: gurmuiK rMgu n idseI hoNdI AKIN AMnHw soeI
transliteration: Guramoukhi Rangu N Disaee Hondee Akheen Annhaa Soee.
translation: He who cannot see the grandneur of gurmukhs is blind despite his eyes.

gurmukhi: gurmuiK smiJ n skeI hoNdI kMnIN bolw hoeI
transliteration: Guramoukhi Samajhi N Sakaee Hondee Kanneen Bolaa Hoee.
translation: He â€˜who does not understand the idea of a gurmukh is deaf despite his ears.

gurmukhi: gurmuiK sbdu n gwveI hoNdI jIBY guMgw goeI
transliteration: Guramoukhi Sabadu N Gaavaee Hondee Jeebhai Goungaa Goee.
translation: He ho does not sing the hymns of Gurmukh is dumb though having a tongue.

gurmukhi: crn kvl dI vwsu ivxu nktw hoNdy nik AloeI
transliteration: Charan Kaval Dee Vaas Vinu Nakataa Honday Naki Aloee.
translation: Devoid of the fragrance of the lotus feet of the Guru, he is supposed to be with a clipped nose (brazen-faced) despite his lovely nose.

gurmukhi: gurmuiK kwr ivhUixAw hoNdI krI luMjw duK roeI
transliteration: Guramoukhi Kaar Vihooniaan Hondee Kareen Lounjaa Doukh Roee.
translation: A person devoid of Gurmukh's sense of service is a wailing cripple, his healthy hands notwithstanding and he goes on weeping.

gurmukhi: gurmiq iciq n vseI so miq hIxu n lhNdw FoeI
transliteration: Guramati Chiti N Vasaee So Mati Heenu Lahadaa Ddhoee.
translation: One in whose heart, the wisdom of the Guru is not sustained, is a fool who gets no shelter anywhere.

gurmukhi: mUrK nwil n koie sQoeI ]3]
transliteration: Moorakh Naali N Koi Sadoee ?3?
translation: The idiot has no companion.

gurmukhi: 4 mUrK, Gu`GU diRStwNq
translation: Fool compared to owl,

gurmukhi: Gu`GU suJ n suJeI vsdI Cif rhY EjwVI
transliteration: Ghoughoo Sujhu N Sujhaee Vasadee Chhadi Rahai Aojaarhee.
translation: Owl does not have any thoughtful understanding and leaving habitats lives in deserted places.

gurmukhi: ieil pVHweI nw pVHY cUhy Kwie aufy dyhwVI
transliteration: Ili Parhhaaee N Parhhai Choohay Khaai Uday Dayhaarhee.
translation: Kite cannot be taught texts and eating rats keeps on flying the whole day.

gurmukhi: vwsu n AwvY vwNs no haumY Aig n cMdx vwVI
transliteration: Vaasu N Aavai Vaans No Haoumai Angi N Channan Vaarhee.
translation: Even being in the garden of sandal wood, the egotist bamboo does not get fragrant.

gurmukhi: sMK smuMdhu sKxw gurmiq hIxw dyh ivgwVI
transliteration: Sankhu Samoundahu Sakhanaa Guramati Heenaa Dayh Vigaarhee.
translation: As the conch remains empty though liviing in sea, the person devoid of the wisdom of Guru (gurmati) is spoiling his body.

gurmukhi: isMmlu ibrKu n sPlu hoie Awp gxwey vfw AnwVI
transliteration: Sinmalu Birakhu N Saphalu Hoi Aapu Ganaaay Vadaa Anaarhee.
translation: The cotton-silk tree does not bear fruit howsoever much that colourless may brag of its greatness.

gurmukhi: mUrKu PkiV pvY irhwVI ]4]
transliteration: Moorakhu Dhakarhi Pavai Rihaarhee ?4?
translation: Only fools quarrls over trivialities.

gurmukhi: 5 mUrK AMnHy dI AwrsI
translation: Mirror before a blind fool

gurmukhi: AMnHy Agy AwrsI nweI Dir n vDweI pwvY
transliteration: Annhay Agai Aarasee Naaee Dhari N Vadhaaee Paavai.
translation: A barber showing mirror to a blind person never gets the reward.

gurmukhi: boly Agy gwvIAY sUMm n fUm kvwie pYnHwvY
transliteration: Bolai Agai Gaaveeai Soomu N Doomu Kavaai Painhaavai.
translation: Singing before a deaf person is in vain and likewise a miser does not present a robe to his minstrel as a gift.

gurmukhi: puCY msliq guMigAhu ivgVY kMmu jvwbu n AwvY
transliteration: Pouchhai Masalati Goungiahu Vigarhai Kanmu Javaabu N Aavai.
translation: If the dumb is consulted on any issue, the issue will go worse and he will not be able to answer.

gurmukhi: PulvwVI viV guxguxw mwlI no n ienwmu idvwvY
transliteration: Phulavaarhee Varhi Gounagounaa Maalee No N Inaamu Divaavai.
translation: If a person devoid of the sense of smell goes to a garden, he cannot recommend the gardener for award.

gurmukhi: lUly nwil ivAwhIAY ikv gil imil kwmix gil lwvY
transliteration: Loolay Naali Viaaheeai Kiv Gali Mili Kaamani Gali Laavai.
translation: How could a woman married to a cripple embrace him.

gurmukhi: sBnw cwl suhwvxI lMgVw kry lKwau lMgwvY
transliteration: Sabhanaa Chaal Suhaavanee Lagarhaa Karay Lakhaau Lagaavai.
translation: Where all others have a fair gait, the lame however he may pretend, would definitely be seen limping.

gurmukhi: lukY n mUrKu Awpu lKwvY ]5]
transliteration: Loukai N Moorakhu Aapu Lakhaavai ?5?
translation: Thus, the fool never remains hidden, and he definitely exposes himself.

gurmukhi: 6 mUrK dw sOrnw
translation: Reclamation of a fool

gurmukhi: pQru mUil n iBjeI sau vriHAwN jil AMdir vsY
transliteration: Padaru Mooli N Bhijaee Sau Varhiaa Jali Andari Vasai.
translation: Even after remaining in water for a hundred years the stone would not get wet at all.

gurmukhi: pQr Kyq n jMmeI cwir mhIny ieMdr vrsY
transliteration: Padar Khaytu N Janmaee Chaari Maheenay Indaru Varasai.
translation: It may rain for four months continuously, but a stone would not sprout in the field.

gurmukhi: pQir cMnxu rgVIey cMnx vwNig n pQru GsY
transliteration: Padari Channanu Ragarheeay Channan Vaangi N Padaru Ghasai.
translation: A stone grinding sandal, never gets worn off like sandal.

gurmukhi: isl vty inq pIsdy rs ks jwxY vwsu n rsY
transliteration: Sil Vatay Nit Peesaday Ras Kas Jaanay Vaasu N Rasai.
translation: Grinding stones always grind the material but never know about the taste and virtues of the things ground.

gurmukhi: ckI iPrY shMsvwr Kwie n pIAY BuK n qsY
transliteration: Chakee Dhirai Sahans Vaar Khaai N Peeai Bhoukh N Tasai.
translation: The grinding stone moves around thousands of times but it never feels hunger or thirst.

gurmukhi: pQr GVY vrqxw hyiT auqy hoie GVw ivxsY
transliteration: Padar Gharhai Varatanaa Haytdi Outay Hoi Gharhaa Vinasai.
translation: The relationship between the stone and the pitcher is such that pitcher has to perish whether the stone strikes the pitcher or vice versa.

gurmukhi: mUrK suriq n js ApjsY ]6]
transliteration: Moorakh Surati N Jas Apajasai ?6?
translation: The stupid does not understand the difference between fame and infamy.

gurmukhi: 7 mUrK p`Qr hY sMg ivc kusMgI rihMdw hY
translation: The fool is a stone; he remains adamant in any company

gurmukhi: pwrs pQr sMgu hY pwrs pris n kMcnu hovY
transliteration: Paaras Padar Sangu Hai Paaras Parasi N Kanchanu Hovai.
translation: Ordinary stone may be in contact with the philosopher's stone but it does not get transformed into gold.

gurmukhi: hIry mwxku pQrhu pQr koie n hwir provY
transliteration: Heeray Maanak Padarahu Padar Koi N Haari Parovai.
translation: Diamonds and rubies are extracted from the stones but the latter cannot be stringed as a necklace.

gurmukhi: vit jvwhru qolIAY muil n quil ivkwie smovY
transliteration: Vati Javaaharu Toleeai Muli N Tuli Vikaai Samovai.
translation: The jewels are weighed with weights but the latter cannot equate in value with the jewels.

gurmukhi: pQr AMdir AstDwqu pwrsu pris suvMn AlovY
transliteration: Padar Andari Asat Dhaatu Paarasu Parasi Suvannu Alovai.
translation: Eight metals (alloys) remain amidst stones but they convert into gold by the touch of philosopher's stone alone.

gurmukhi: pQru Ptk Jlkxw bhu rMgI hoie rMgu n govY
transliteration: Padaru Dhatak Jhalakanaa Bahu Rangee Hoi Rangu N Govai.
translation: Crystal stone shines in many colours but still remains a mere stone.

gurmukhi: pQr vwsu n swau hY mn kTor hoie Awpu ivgovY
transliteration: Padar Vaasu N Saau Hai Man Katdoru Hoi Aapu Vigovai.
translation: Stone has neither fragrance nor taste; the hard-hearted one simply destroys itself.

gurmukhi: kir mUrKweI mUrKu rovY ]7]
transliteration: Kari Moorakhaaee Moorakhu Rovai ?7?
translation: The foolish goes on lamenting his own stupidity.

gurmukhi: 8 mUrK dw sMg nw kro
translation: Do not keep company with a foolish one

gurmukhi: ijauN mix kwly sp isir swr n jwxY ivsU BirAw
transliteration: Jioun Mani Kaalay Sap Siri Saar N Jaanai Visoo Bhariaa.
translation: Having jewel in its head and knowing it not, the snake remains filled with poison.

gurmukhi: jwxu kQUrI imrg qin JwVwN isM|dw iPrY APirAw
transliteration: Jaanu Kadooree Mirag Tani Jhaarhaan Sindaa Dhirai Adhariaa.
translation: It is known that musk remains in the body of deer, but it goes on smelling it franatically in the bushes.

gurmukhi: ijauN kir moqI isp ivic mrm n jwxY AMdir DirAw
transliteration: Jioun Kari Motee Sip Vichi Maramu N Jaanai Andari Dhariaa.
translation: The pearl dwells in the shell but the shell does not know the mystery.

gurmukhi: ijauN gweI Qix iccuVI duDu n pIAY lohU jirAw
transliteration: Jioun Gaaeen Dani Chichurhee Dudhu N Peeai Lohoo Jariaa.
translation: The tick stuck with the teats of cow, takes not its milk but sucks the blood only.

gurmukhi: bgulw qrix n isiKE qIriQ nwie n pQru qirAw
transliteration: Bagalaa Tarani N Sikhiao Teeradi Nhaai N Padaru Tariaa.
translation: Living in water the crane never learns how to swim and the stone, in spite of its ablutions at various pilgrimage centres cannot swim and go across.

gurmukhi: nwil isAwxy BlI iBK mUrK rwjhu kwju n sirAw
transliteration: Naali Siaanay Bhalee Bhikh Moorakh Raajahu Kaaju N Sariaa.
translation: That is why, begging in the company of wise people is better then ruling over a kingdom alongwith Hoots.

gurmukhi: myKI hoie ivgwVY KirAw ]8]
transliteration: Maykhee Hoi Vigaarhai Khariaa ?8?
translation: Because he who himself is fake, will also spoil the pure one.

gurmukhi: 9 mUrK nwl Epry rho
translation: Be indifferent to the company of fools

gurmukhi: ktxu ctxu kuiqAwN kuqY hlk qY mnu sUgwvY
transliteration: Katanu Chatanu Koutiaan Koutai Halak Tai Manu Soogaavai.
translation: The dog, only bites and licks but if it goes mad, one's mind becomes scared of it.

gurmukhi: TMFw qqw koielw kwlw kir kY hQ jlwvY
transliteration: Tdaddhaa Tataa Koilaa Kaalaa Kari Kai Hadu Jalaavai.
translation: Coal whether cold or hot makes the hand black or burns it.

gurmukhi: ijau ckcUMDr sp dI AMnHw koVHI kir idKlwvY
transliteration: Jiu Chakachoondhar Sap Dee Annhaa Korhhee Kari Dikhalaavai.
translation: Mole caught by snake makes it blind or leper.

gurmukhi: jwxu rsaulI dyh ivic vFI pIV rKI srmwvY
transliteration: Jaanu Rasaulee Dayh Vichi Vaddhee Peerh Rakhee Saramaavai.
translation: Tumor in the body when operated upon gives pain and if it is kept untouched it is a cause for embarrassment.

gurmukhi: vMis kpUqu kulCxw CifAw bxY n ivic smwvY
transliteration: Vansi Kapootu Kulachhanaa Chhadai Banai N Vichi Samaavai.
translation: A wicked son can neither be repudiated nor he can adjust in the family.

gurmukhi: mUrK hyqu n lweIAY prhir vYru Ailpqu vlwvY
transliteration: Moorakh Haytu N Laaeeai Parahari Vairu Alipatu Valaavai.
translation: Therefore, the stupid should not be loved and while enmity towards him should be avoided, detachment towards him should be maintained.

gurmukhi: duhIN pvwVI duiK ivhwvY ]9]
transliteration: Duheen Pavaarheen Doukhi Vihaavai ?9?
translation: Otherwise, both the ways, suffering is bound to occur.

gurmukhi: 10 mUrK byQvw qy AOgux gRwhI hY
translation: The fool is absurd and chooses evils

gurmukhi: ijau hwQI dw nHwvxw bwhir inkil Kyh aufwvY
transliteration: Jiu Haadee Daa Nhaavanaa Baahari Nikali Khayh Udaavai.
translation: As the elephant washes its body and coming out of water, it throws mud over it;

gurmukhi: ijau aUTY dw Kwvxw prhir kxk jvwhw KwvY
transliteration: Jiu Ootdai Daa Khaavanaa Parahari Kanak Javaahaan Khaavai.
translation: As the camel avoiding wheat eats low variety of corn named java-s;

gurmukhi: kmly dw kCotVw kdy lk kdy sIis vlwvY
transliteration: Kamalay Daa Kachhotarhaa Kaday Lak Kaday Seesi Valaavai.
translation: The loin cloth of mad man is sometimes worn by him around his waiste and sometimes on his head;

gurmukhi: ijauN kir tuMfy hQVw so cuqIN so vwiq vqwvY
transliteration: Jioun Kari Tounday Hadarhaa So Chouteen So Vaati Vataavai.
translation: The hand of a cripple sometime goes to his buttocks and the same one sometimes to his mouth when yawning;

gurmukhi: sMnHI jwxu luhwr dI iKxu jil ivic iKn Agin smwvY
transliteration: Sannhee Jaanu Luhaar Dee Khinu Jali Vichi Khin Agani Samaavai.
translation: Blacksmith's pincers are sometimes put in fire and the next moment in water;

gurmukhi: mKI bwxu kubwxu hY lY durgMDu sugMD n BwvY
transliteration: Makhee Baanu Koubaanu Hai Lai Duragandh Sougandh N Bhaavai.
translation: Evil is the nature of fly, it prefers foul smell to fragrance;

gurmukhi: mUrK dw ikhu hiQ n AwvY ]10]
transliteration: Moorakh Daa Kihu Hadi N Aavai ?10?
translation: Likewise, the fool gets nothing.

gurmukhi: 11 mUrK Awpy Psdy qy kuP`kVI hn
translation: Foolish gets himself entrapped and is a liar

gurmukhi: qoqw nlI n CfeI Awpx hQIN PwQw cIkY
transliteration: Totaa Nalee N Chhadaee Aapan Hadeen Dhaadaa Cheekai.
translation: The parrot does not leave the rod and caught in it cries and wails.

gurmukhi: bwNdru muiT n CfeI Gir Gir ncY JIkxu JIkY
transliteration: Baandaru Moutdi N Chhadaee Ghari Ghari Nachai Jheekanu Jheekai.
translation: Monkey too does not leave the handful of corn (in the pitcher) and suffers dancing and gritting its teeth from door to door.

gurmukhi: gdhu AVI n CfeI cIGI paudI hIkix hIkY
transliteration: Gadahu Arhee N Chhadaee Reeghee Paudee Heekani Heekai.
translation: The donkey also when beaten, kicks and brays loudly but does not shed its stubbornness.

gurmukhi: kuqy ckI ctxI pUC n isDI DRIkix DRIkY
transliteration: Koutay Chakee N Chatanee Poochh N Sidhee Dhreekani Dhreekai.
translation: The dog does not leave licking the flour mill and its tail though pulled, never turns straight.

gurmukhi: krin kuPkV mUrKwN sp gey PiV Pwtin lIkY
transliteration: Karani Kudhakarh Moorakhaan Sap Gaay Dharhi Dhaatani Leekai.
translation: The foolish ones boast foolishly and beat the track while the snake has gone away.

gurmukhi: pg lhwie gxwie srIkY ]11]
transliteration: Pag Lahaai Ganaai Sareekai ?12?
translation: Even when humiliated by their turbans taken off their heads, they count themselves superior to their collaterals.

gurmukhi: 12 mUrK s`c dw Xwr nhIN
translation: Stupid is not friendly to truth

gurmukhi: AMnHw AwKy liV mrY KusI hovY suix nwau sujwKw
transliteration: Annhaa Aakhay Larhi Marai Khousee Hovai Souni Naau Sujaakhaa.
translation: The blind stupid one fights to the finish if he is called blind (intellectually) and feels flattered if called eyed (a wise one).

gurmukhi: Bolw AwKy Blw mMin Ahmku jwix Ajwix n BwKw
transliteration: Bholaa Aakhay Bhalaa Manni Ahamaku Jaani Ajaani N Bhaakhaa.
translation: Calling him simple minded makes him feel good but he would not talk to one who tells him that he is a silly person.

gurmukhi: DorI AwKY his dy bld vKwix krY min mwKw
transliteration: Dhoreen Aakhai Hasi Day Balad Vakhaani Karai Mani Maakhaa.
translation: He smiles at being called a carrier of the burden (of all) but feels angry when told that he is just an ox.

gurmukhi: kwauN isAwxp jwxdw ivstw Kwie n BwK suBwKw
transliteration: Kaaoun Siaanap Jaanadaa Visataa Khaai N Bhaakh Soubhaakhaa.
translation: The crow knows many skills but it crows jarringly and eats faeces.

gurmukhi: nwau surIq kurIq dw musk iblweI gwNfI swKw
transliteration: Naau Sureet Kureet Daa Mousak Bilaaee Gaandee Saakhaa.
translation: To the bad customs the stupid refers as good conduct and calls the indurated faeces of cat, fragrant.

gurmukhi: hyiT KVw QU QU krY igdV hiQ n AwvY dwKw
transliteration: Haytdi Kharhaa Doo Doo Karai Gidarh Hadi N Aavai Daakhaa.
translation: As the jackal unable to reach and eat grapes on tree, spits over them, so is the case of a fool.

gurmukhi: bolivgwVu mUrKu ByfwKw ]12]
transliteration: Bolavigaarhu Moorakhu Bhaydaakhaa ?12?
translation: The foolish person is a blind follower like sheep and his obdurate talk spoils his relationship with every one.

gurmukhi: 13 mUrK ivx gux gurbI hY
translation: Devoid of virtues, the stupid is arrogant

gurmukhi: ruKwN ivic kuruKu hY ArMfu A\\\\weI Awpu gxwey
transliteration: Roukhaan Vichi Kuroukhu Hai Arandu Avaaee Aapu Ganaaay.
translation: The worst possible among the trees is castor tree which undesrvedly makes itself noticed.

gurmukhi: ipdw ijau pMKyrUAwN bih bih fwlI bhuqu bPwey
transliteration: Pidaa Jiu Pankhayrooaan Bahi Bahi Daalee Bahoutu Badhaaay.
translation: Pidd jiu, a very small among the birds goes an jumping from one branch to another and feels much inflated.

gurmukhi: Byf iBivMgw muhu krY qrxwpY idih cwir vlwey
transliteration: Bhayd Bhivingaa Muhu Karai Taranaapai Dihi Chaari Valaaay.
translation: The sheep, too, during its brief... youth bleats loudly (proudly).

gurmukhi: muhu AKI nku kn ijauN ieMdRIAwN ivic gwNif sdwey
transliteration: Muhu Akhee Naku Kan Jioun Indreeaan Vichi Gaandi Sadaaay.
translation: Anus also feels proud of being called one of the organs like eye, ear, nose and mouth.

gurmukhi: mIAw Grhu inkwlIAY qrksu drvwjy tMgvwey
transliteration: Meeaa Gharahu Nikaaleeai Tarakasu Daravaajay Tangavaaay.
translation: The husband even while kicked out of home by wife hangs his quiver at the door (to show his masculinity).

gurmukhi: mUrK AMdir mwxswN ivxu gux grbu krY Awlwey
transliteration: Moorakh Andari Maanasaan Vinu Goun Garabu Karai Aakhaaay.
translation: Similarly among the human beings, the stupid one devoid of all virtues feels proud of himself and persistently tries to get noticed.

gurmukhi: mjls bYTw Awpu lKwey ]13]
transliteration: Majalas Baitdaa Aapu Lakhaaay ?13?
translation: In an assembly, he beholds only his ownself (and not the wisdom of others).

gurmukhi: 14 mUrK kOx hY
translation: Who is a fool?   ?

gurmukhi: mUrK iqs no AwKIAY bolu n smJY boil n jwxY
transliteration: Moorakh Tis No Aakheeai Bolu N Samajhai Boli N Jaanai.
translation: Foolish is he who neither understands the matter in hand nor speaks well.

gurmukhi: horo ikhu kir puCIAY horo ikau kir AwiK vKwxY
transliteration: Horo Kihu Kari Pouchheeai Horo Kihu Kari Aakhi Vakhaanai.
translation: He is asked something else and he replies altogether about something different.

gurmukhi: isK dyie smJweIAY ArQu AnrQu mnY ivic AwxY
transliteration: Sikh Dayi Samajhaaeeai Aradu Anaradu Manai Vichi Aanai.
translation: Ill advised, he misinterprets it and brings forth from his mind the contrary meaning.

gurmukhi: vfw AsmJu n smJeI suriq ivhUxw hoie hYrwxY
transliteration: Vadaa Asamajhu N Samajhaee Surati Vihoonaa Hoi Hairaanai.
translation: He is a big idiot who does not understand and being devoid of consciousness is ever surprised and confused.

gurmukhi: gurmiq iciq n AwveI durmiq imqRu sqRu prvwxY
transliteration: Guramati Chiti N Aanaee Duramati Mitr Satr Paravaanai.
translation: He never cherishes in his heart the wisdom of the Gum and due to his evil intellect considers his friend as a foe.

gurmukhi: AgnI sphuN vrjIAY gux ivic Avgux krY iD|wxY
transliteration: Aganee Sapahoun Varajeeai Goun Vichi Avagoun Karai Dhiaanai.
translation: The wisdom of not going near snake and fire he takes otherwise and forcibly turns virtue into vice.

gurmukhi: mUqy rovY mwN n is\\\\wxY ]14]
transliteration: Mootai Rovai Maa N Siaanai ?14?
translation: He behaves like an infant who does not recognise his mother and goes on crying and pissing.

gurmukhi: 15 mUrK dI pCwx
translation: Identification of a fool

gurmukhi: rwhu Cif auJiV pvY AwgU no Bulw kir jwxY
transliteration: Raahu Chhadi Ujharhi Pavai Aagoo No Bhulaa Kari Jaanai.
translation: He who leaving the path away follows a trackless waste and considers his leader gone astray, is a fool.

gurmukhi: byVy ivic bhwlIAY kuid pvY ivic vhx iD|wxY
transliteration: Bayrhay Vichi Bahaaleeai Kudi Pavai Vichi Vahan Dhiaanai.
translation: Seated in the boat he jumps impulsively into the current.

gurmukhi: suGVwN ivic bihiTAwN boilivgwiV auGwiV vKwxY
transliteration: Sougharhaan Vichi Bahitdiaan Bolivigaarhi Oughaarhi Vakhaanai.
translation: Sitting among the noble ones he, due to his ill talk stands exposed.

gurmukhi: suGVwN mUrK jwxdw Awip suGVu hoie ivrqIhwxY
transliteration: Sougharhaan Moorakh Jaanadaa Aapi Sougharhu Hoi Virateehaanai.
translation: The wise he considers stupid and hids his own conduct as a clever one.

gurmukhi: idh no rwiq vKwxdw cwmciVk ijvyN twnwxY
transliteration: Dih No Raati Vakhaanadaa Chaamacharhik Jivayn Taanaanai.
translation: Like , a bat and a glow worm he describes the day as night.

gurmukhi: gurmiq mUrKu iciq n AwxY ]15]
transliteration: Guramati Moorakhu Chiti N Aanai ?15?
translation: The wisdom of Gum never resides in the heart of a foolish person.

gurmukhi: 16 mUrK dw AMq
translation: The end of a fool

gurmukhi: vYid cMgyrI auTxI lY isl vtw kcrw BMnw
transliteration: Vaidi Changayree Ootdanee Lai Sil Vataa Kacharaa Bhannaa.
translation: A physician in order to cure a female camel, of a melon stuck in its throat, crushed the melon in its throat by hitting out side the neck with his pestle and mortar.

gurmukhi: syvik isKI vYdgI mwrI buFI rovin rMnw
transliteration: Sayvaki Sikhee Vaidagee Maaree Buddhee Rovani Rannaa.
translation: His servant (who was watching) thought he had mastered the art and killed an old ill woman by the same process, causing general lamentation among women.

gurmukhi: pkiV clwieAw rwvlY paudI auGiV gey su kMnw
transliteration: Pakarhi Chalaaiaa Raavalai Paudee Ougharhi Gaay Su Kannaa.
translation: The people seized the pretending physician and produced him before the king who ordered for him a thorough beating, upon which he came to his senses.

gurmukhi: puCY AwiK vKwixaunu auGiV gieAw pwju prCMnw
transliteration: Pouchhai Aakhi Vakhaaniounu Ougharhi Gaiaa Paaju Parachhannaa.
translation: When questioned he confessed the whole circumstance and his imposture was thus exposed.

gurmukhi: pwrKUAw cuix kiFAw ijau kckVw n rlY rqMnw
transliteration: Paarakhooaa Chouni Kaddhiaa Jiu Kachakarhaa N Ralai Ratannaa.
translation: The wise men threw him out as a piece of glass cannot rank with jewels.

gurmukhi: mUrKu AklI bwhrw vwNshu mUil n hovI gMnw
transliteration: Moorakhu Akalee Baaharaa Vaansahu Mooli N Hovee Gannaa.
translation: A fool has no sense as a bamboo could never equal sugar-cane.

gurmukhi: mwxs dyhI psU aupMnw ]16]
transliteration: Maanas Dayhee Pasoo Oupannaa ?16?
translation: He in fact, is an animal born in the form of a man.

gurmukhi: 17 mUrK rIs dw Pl Bogdw hY
translation: The foolish undergoes the results of imitation

gurmukhi: mhwdyv dI syv kir vru pwieAw swhY dy puqY
transliteration: Mahaadayv Dee Sayv Kari Varu Paaiaa Saahai Day Poutai.
translation: The son of a banker served Mahadev and got a boon (of attaining wealth).

gurmukhi: drbu srUp sryvVY Awie vVy Gir AMdir auqY
transliteration: Darabu Saroop Sarayvarhai Aaay Varhay Ghari Andari Outai.
translation: Wealth came to his house in the guise of sadhus of gramanic tradition.

gurmukhi: ijau hiQAwrI mwrIAin iqau iqau drb hoih DV DuqY
transliteration: Jiu Hadiaaree Maareeani Tiu Tiu Darab Hoi Dharhadhoutai.
translation: As they were beaten, heaps of money emerged there in his house.

gurmukhi: buqI krdy ifiTEnu nweI cYnu n bYTy suqY
transliteration: Boutee Karaday Ditdiaonu Naaee Chainu N Baitday Soutai.
translation: A barber working in the house also saw this scene and he becoming restive lost his sleep.

gurmukhi: mwry Awix sryvVy suix dIbwix mswix ACuqY
transliteration: Maaray Aani Sarayvarhay Souni Deebaani Masaani Achhoutai.
translation: Availing an opportunity he killed all the sadhus and the matter of the innocent victims came to the court of law.

gurmukhi: mQY vwil pCwiVAw vwl Cfwien iks dY buqY
transliteration: Madai Vaali Pachhaarhiaa Vaal Chhadaaiani Kis Dai Boutai.
translation: Catching hold from his hair he was thrashed. Now by what power he will give rescued from that clutch.

gurmukhi: mUrKu bIjY bIau kurqY ]17]
transliteration: Moorakhu Beejai Beeu Kuroutai ?17?
translation: The foolish sows seeds out of season (and suffers loss).

gurmukhi: 18 pMfq vI mUrK ho skdw hY
translation: Even a pandit could be a fool

gurmukhi: gosit gwNgy qylIAY pMifq nwil hovY jgu dyKY
transliteration: Gosati Gaangay Tayleeai Pandit Naali Hovai Jagu Daykhai.
translation: A discussion between Gangu, the oilman and a pandit was being witnessed by one and all.

gurmukhi: KVI krY iek AMgulI gwNgw duie vyKwlY ryKY
transliteration: Kharhee Karai Ik Angulee Gaangaa Dui Vaykhaalai Raykhai.
translation: Showing one finger to Gang/ the pandit indicated that the Lord is one. But Gangu thought that he wanted to extract his (Ganges) one eye and hence he showed two fingers indicating that he will bring out both of his (pandit's) eyes.

gurmukhi: Pyir aucwie pMjwNgulw gwNgw muiT hlwie AlyKY
transliteration: Dhayri Ouchaai Panjaangulaa Gaangaa Moutdi Halaai Alaykhai.
translation: But the pandit thought that Gangu is hinting at the two dimensions of Lord - nirgun (beyond all virtues) and sagun, (with all virtues).

gurmukhi: pYrI pY auiT cilAw pMifqu hwir BulwvY ByKY
transliteration: Paireen Pai Outdi Chaliaa Panditu Haari Bhulaavai Bhaykhai.
translation: Pandit now raised five fingers to show that His two forms are due to the five elements, but, considering the pandit as indicating that with five fingers he would scratch the face of Gangu,

gurmukhi: inrguxu srguxu AMg duie prmysru pMij imlin sryKY
transliteration: Niragounu Saragounu Ang Dui Paramaysaru Panji Milani Saraykhai.
translation: Gangs brandished his fist showing that he would kill him by the stroke of his fist. Now pandit felt that he was being made to understand that unity of five elements was the cause of the creation.

gurmukhi: AKI dovyN BMnswN mukI lwie hlwie inmyKY
transliteration: Akheen Dovain Bhannasaan Moukee Laai Halaai Nimaykhai.
translation: Mistakingly the pandit accepted his defeat and fell at his opponent's feet and left the place. In fact the fool had meant that he would bring out his eyes and attack with a tight fist but this was interpreted differently by the pandit.

gurmukhi: mUrK pMifqu suriq ivsyKY ]18]
transliteration: Moorakh Panditu Surati Visaykhai ?18?
translation: Thus because of his specific thinking even the pandit was also proved a fool.

gurmukhi: 19 mUrK dI sMgq dw Pl
translation: The result of association with the stupid one

gurmukhi: TMFy KUhhuM nHwie kY pg ivswir AwieAw isir nMgY
transliteration: Tdaddhay Khoohahoun Nhaai Kai Pag Visaari Aaiaa Siri Nagai.
translation: Having taken bath on the well, a person forgot his turban and returned home bare headed.

gurmukhi: Gr ivic rMnw kmlIAwN DusI lIqI dyiK kuFMgY
transliteration: Ghar Vichi Rannaan Kamaleeaan Dhousee Leetee Daykhi Kuddhangai.
translation: Seeing his improper conduct (of being bare headed) the silly women started weeping and wailing (Seeing turbanless master of the house they conjectured the death of some one in the family).

gurmukhi: rMnw dyiK iptMdIAw FwhwN mwrYN hoie insMgY
transliteration: Rannaan Daykhi Pitandeeaan Ddhaahaan Maarain Hoi Nisangai.
translation: Seeing the weeping women, others too, began mourning. People gethered and sitting in lines started condoling with the family.

gurmukhi: lok isAwpy AwieAw rMnw purs juVy lY pMgY
transliteration: Lok Siaapay Aaiaa Rannaan Puras Jurhay Lai Pangai.
translation: Now the barber woman who leads the mourning on occasions asked as to who is to be wept and whose dirge she should lead, i.e. what is the name of the dead.

gurmukhi: nwiex puCdI iptdIAwN iks dY nwie AlHwxI AMgY
transliteration: Naain Pouchhadee Pitadeeaan Kis Dai Naai Alhaanee Angai.
translation: The daughter-in-law of family hinted towards father-in-law to elicit answer of this question (because he was found bare headed.

gurmukhi: shury puCh jwie kY kaux muAw nUh auqru mMgY
transliteration: Sahuray Pouchhahu Jaai Kai Kaoun Muaa Nooh Outaru Mangai.
translation: Then the fact was disclosed by him that he just forgot to wear turban).

gurmukhi: kwvwN rOlw mUrKu sMgY ]19]
transliteration: Kaavaan Raulaa Moorakhu Sangai ?19?
translation: In the assembly of the fools such cawing takes place (because crows also listening to one voice start cawing jointly).

gurmukhi: 20 mUrK nwl ik`kur vrqIey
translation: How to deal with a fool

gurmukhi: jy mUrKu smJweIAY smJY nwhI Cwv n Dupw
transliteration: Jay Moorakhu Samajhaaeeai Samajhai Naahee Chhaanv N Dhoupaa.
translation: Even if told about the shade and the sunshine, the fool does not understand it.

gurmukhi: AKIN priK n jwxeI ipql suienw kYhwN rupw
transliteration: Akheen Parakhi N Jaanaee Pital Suinaa Kaihaan Roupaa.
translation: With his eyes he cannot distinguish between brass and bronze or gold and silver.

gurmukhi: swau n jwxY qyl iGA DirAw koil GVolw kupw
transliteration: Saau N Jaanai Tayl Ghia Dhariaa Koli Gharholaa Koupaa.
translation: He can not know the difference of taste between the pot of ghee and an oil vessel.

gurmukhi: suriq ivhUxw rwiq idhu cwnxu quil AnHyrw Gupw
transliteration: Surati Vihoonaa Raati Dihu Chaananu Tuli Anhayraa Ghoupaa.
translation: Day and night he is devoid of consciousness and to him light and darkness are the same.

gurmukhi: vwsu kQUrI Qom dI imhr kulI ADauVI qupw
transliteration: Vaasu Kadooree Dom Dee Mihar Kulee Adhaurhee Toupaa.
translation: Fragrance of musk and odour of garlic or stiching of velvet and hide are the same for him.

gurmukhi: vYrI imqR n smJeI rMgu surMg kurMgu ACupw
transliteration: Vairee Mitr N Samajhaee Rangu Surang Kurangu Achhoupaa.
translation: He does not identify a friend and an enemy and remains completely unconcerned towards the bad or good colour (of life).

gurmukhi: mUrK nwil cMgyrI cupw ]20]32]
transliteration: Moorakh Naali Changayree Choupaa ?20?32?bateeha?
translation: Silence is the best in the company of fool.

gurmukhi: duibDw invwir Abrn huie brn ibKY pwNc prpMc n drs Adrs hY
transliteration: Doubidhaa Nivaari Abaran Hui Baran Bikhai , Paanch Parapanch N Daras Adaras Hai ?
translation: By perpetual meditation on Lord's name, a Guru-conscious person distances himself from duality and caste discrimination. He frees himself from the grip of five vices (lust, anger, greed, ego and attachment) nor does he entangle himself in the rationales o

gurmukhi: prm pwrs gur pris pwrs Bey kink Aink Dwqu Awpw Aprs hY
transliteration: Param Paaras Gur Parasi Paaras Bhaay , Kanik Anik Dhaatu Aapaa Aparas Hai ?
translation: Just as an iron piece when touched with a philosopher-stone becomes gold, similarly a devotee meeting Guru becomes a pious and a clean man.

gurmukhi: nv duAwr duAwr pwirbRmwsn isMGwsn mY inJr Jrin rucq n An rs hY
transliteration: Nav Duaar Duaar Paaribramaasan Singhaasan Mai , Nijhar Jharani Rouchat N An Ras Hai ?
translation: Overcoming the pleasures of the nine doors of the body, he rests his faculties in the tenth door, where the divine elixir flows perpetually that turn him away from all other pleasures.

gurmukhi: gur isK sMiD imly bIs iekIs eIs Anhd gd gd ABr Brs hY ]32]
transliteration: Gur Sikh Sandhi Milay Bees Ikees Eesa , Anahad Gad Gad Abhar Bharas Hai ?32?
translation: Be assured that the meeting of Guru and a disciple, makes a disciple realise Lord and virtually becomes like Him. His  heart then remains immersed in the celestial music. (32)
